en: Can I have some water, please?
Could I get some water, please?
May I have a glass of water?
Just water, please.
The rights you requested do not belong to us.
zh: 你要求的这些权利不属于我们。

en: May I have the honor of asking you?
I'd like a doll, a new bicycle.....and peace on earth!
zh: 我想要个娃娃，一辆新自行车……还有世界和平！

en: No gratuity accepted.
Thank you again for your good thoughts.
Thanks so much for your good thoughts.
I'm very grateful for your sympathy.
This way, please, mademoiselle.
What's your daughter's name?
Your daughter passed the examination, I hear.
I ask to see your daughter.
Would you like a ride?
It was kind of you to invite us.
Thank you very much for your invitation.
What size do you wear?
This accident has nothing to do with me, officer.
zh: 警官，这起事故跟我没关系。

en: Here comes a copper!
I am pleased at your coming.
Let's have sushi.
You can't drive. You've been drinking.
It was gracious of you to accept.
Can I drink alcohol?
Let's have sake.
As he was drinking he got very merry and kept telling everybody just how much he hated hospitals.
zh: 他喝着喝着就嗨了，不停地跟所有人说他有多讨厌医院。

en: No drinkers.
Liquor will have an effect on a person.
The minute I have something to drink, I turn bright red.
Do you drink alcohol?
Everybody has their favorite drink.
zh: 每个人都有自己爱喝的。

en: Drinking too much is bad for the health.
I can't help you. As a matter of fact, I'm very busy just now.
zh: 我帮不了你。事实上，我现在特别忙。

en: Shall I help you?
I am willing to help you.
I said, "Is there anything I can do?"
zh: 我说：“有什么我能帮忙的吗？”

en: I asked you if you wanted some help.
zh: 我问过你需不需要帮忙。

en: Let me help you.
The maid was dead tired of her household chores.
zh: 女佣对那些家务活儿烦透了。

en: The maid immediately cleaned the dishes from the table.
zh: 女佣立刻把桌上的餐具收走了。

en: The servants tried to carry out their master's order.
zh: 仆人们试图执行主人的命令。

en: The maid made my bed.
It's very decent of you to help me.
I'd be very grateful if you'd help me.
zh: 你要是能帮我，那就太感谢了。

en: Could you help me?
It's very kind of you to help me.
Thank you for your assistance.
May I use the bathroom?
Could you show me where the bathroom is?
May I trouble you to pass me the salt?
zh: 麻烦把盐递给我一下，好吗？

en: I'm sorry to bother you.
I'm at a complete loss!
Don't be too hard on me, please.
I am in receipt of your letter.
Thank you very much for your letter.
I hereby beg to acknowledge your letter.
zh: 我在此确认收到了你的信。

en: I acknowledged the receipt of your letter.
zh: 我确认收到了你的来信。

en: I received your letter.
I am looking forward to your letter.
Your letter reached me only today, having been delayed by the heavy snow.
zh: 因为大雪耽搁了，你的信今天才送到。

en: Thank you for writing.
Thank you for your letter.
You're my good omen.
Thank you for your business.
Would you like me to order it?
A young person wants to see you.
I am sorry if I disturbed you.
zh: 不好意思，打扰到你了吧。

en: I hope I'm not disturbing you.
Thank you very much for your hospitality.
zh: 非常感谢你的盛情款待。

en: I'm sorry to disturb you, but there's a phone call for you.
zh: 不好意思打扰一下，有你的电话。

en: I'm sorry to bother you, but I would like to ask you a favor.
zh: 不好意思麻烦你一下，我想请你帮个忙。

en: Stop putting on an act.
Do you like the theater?
The custom of bowing is peculiar to the islanders.
zh: 鞠躬是这些岛民特有的习俗。

en: Do you have a few minutes to spare?
I am sorry to have taken up your valuable time.
zh: 不好意思耽误了您的宝贵时间。

en: Do you have the time?
Please come and see me if you have time.
Do you have some time?
Is it to go?
Have mercy on me and spare my life, please!
zh: 饶命啊，求求你放过我吧！

en: With reference to the invoice No.56789 which was due last month, we have not yet received your remittance.
zh: 关于上个月到期的56789号发票，我们还没收到您的汇款。

en: How would you like to pay?
How would you like to pay for it?
We remind you that our terms are 60 days net.
zh: 提醒您一下，我们的账期是60天。

en: May we therefore ask you for a two months' extension of credit?
zh: 能不能麻烦您给我们延期两个月付款？

en: Your payment is now two months overdue.
zh: 您的款项已经逾期两个月了。

en: Bring your children with you.
I'm sure the children are getting big.
zh: 孩子们肯定都长高了不少。

en: Is the kid still up?
You should build a fire under the kid.
How old are your children?
How are you and your wife doing, now that the birds have all flown the coop?
zh: 既然孩子们都搬出去住了，你和你爱人过得怎么样？

en: May his life be blessed with health and happiness all through.
Do you have any children?
Please let me pick up your sister at the station.
zh: 让我去车站接你姐姐吧。

en: I feel very sorry for your sister.
zh: 我为你姐姐感到很难过。

en: Will you give my best regards to your sister?
Will you go out on an errand?
I regret to say I can't come.
How is your work getting along?
zh: 你工作进展得怎么样了？

en: Please wash the dishes.
Would you put the dishes in the sink?
Eat everything on your plate, or you won't get any dessert.
zh: 把盘子里的东西都吃光，不然没甜点吃。

en: You'd better eat everything that's on your plate.
zh: 你最好把盘子里的东西都吃了。

en: I'd like to go to Takayama during festival time.
zh: 我想在祭典的时候去高山。

en: The date of the festival coincides with that of the exam.
zh: 祭典的日子正好和考试那天重合了。

en: I greatly appreciate your efforts during our festival.
zh: 非常感谢你在祭典期间的付出。

en: Sending year-end gifts is one of the customs peculiar to Japan.
zh: 年终送礼是日本特有的习俗之一。

en: Do you want to sit down?
Pass the sugar, please.
I will help you if you are in trouble.
zh: 如果你遇到困难，我会帮你的。

en: I'd be happy to help you if you're having trouble.
zh: 如果你遇到麻烦，我很乐意帮忙。

en: Behave yourself.
What language do you speak in your country?
Behave yourself, and you'll get something nice.
Where are your manners?
What about your manners!
Watch yourself.
I hope you'll be happy forever.
My clothes have an oily smell because I ate at an okonomiyaki place.
zh: 因为在大阪烧店吃过饭，我衣服上一股油烟味。

en: Add salt and pepper to taste.
You may call on me whenever you like.
Whatever you like.
Help yourself to whatever you like.
Please help yourself to any food you like.
Sit wherever you like.
Have a satsuma for dessert.
Well, do you like it?
OK, so that's it for me. Now I'll hand things over to the next speaker.
zh: 好了，我说完了。下面交给下一位发言者。

en: We solved the problem by mutual concessions.
zh: 我们通过互相让步解决了问题。

en: The chemistry is right for us.
Don't you get on each other's nerves?
zh: 你们难道不觉得对方很烦吗？

en: They are bitter enemies.
Let's try to understand one another.
zh: 咱们试着多理解对方吧。

en: There must be a better person for both of us.
zh: 肯定有更适合我们俩的人。

en: Let's stop finding fault with each other.
Let's keep in touch with each other.
To understand each other is important.
Let's agree to share in the profits.
Can we effect a compromise?
So there's no love lost between them then?
zh: 所以他们俩关系很僵，对吧？

en: It is our duty to help one another.
zh: 互相帮助是我们的责任。

en: I don't like families that quarrel amongst themselves.
zh: 我不喜欢闹内讧的家庭。

en: It seems we are in the same boat.
Find mutual interests, and you will get along with each other.
zh: 找点共同兴趣，你们就能相处得更好了。

en: You called?
What's the name of the party you're calling?
I will bear your words in mind.
zh: 我会把你的话记在心里的。

en: If you insist, I'll have another drink.
zh: 既然你坚持，那我就再喝一杯。

en: I will borrow it then, if you insist.
zh: 既然你坚持，那我就借了吧。

en: How have you been?
I hope this letter finds you well.
Good luck to you!
Thank you for coming.
It's so kind of you to come to see me off.
zh: 你能来送我，真是太有心了。

en: It's nice of you to see me off.
Good show!
I'm sure people ask you this question all the time, but it's all that comes to mind right now.
zh: 我敢说肯定总有人问你这个问题，但我现在也只想到这个。

en: Here they come.
Do you want the doctors to use the machine to make your brother breathe?
zh: 你想让医生用呼吸机维持你哥哥的呼吸吗？

en: Can your brother drive a car?
Compared with his brother, he is a poor athlete.
zh: 跟他哥哥比起来，他的运动细胞差远了。

en: Your brother got married, didn't he?
He wants the money.
For people who dislike the idea of giving money, a gift certificate is a good idea.
zh: 对于不喜欢直接给钱的人来说，送礼品卡是个好主意。

en: I can't lend you any money.
I will do that work on condition that I get paid for it.
zh: 只要给钱，我就干那个活儿。

en: I caught a pickpocket dead to rights when he stole my money.
zh: 那个小偷在偷我钱的时候，被我抓了个正着。

en: It is wrong to steal money.
My money was stolen.
I'm trying to save money.
Can you save enough money for the down payment?
I can't lend you money, because I don't have any myself.
zh: 我没法借钱给你，因为我自己也没钱。

en: Would you lend me some money?
All the money spent, we started looking for work.
zh: 钱都花光了，我们开始找工作了。

en: All the money put together still won't be enough.
zh: 所有的钱加起来还是不够。

en: Should I insert coins first?
Will you lend me some money?
I have got some money.
Give me a little money.
We should not make too much of money.
zh: 我们不应该把钱看得太重。

en: It is against my principles to borrow money.
Is it possible to borrow money?
I ran all over town trying to borrow some money.
zh: 我跑遍了全城想借点儿钱。

en: People with money were able to buy butter.
zh: 有钱的人才能买得起黄油。

en: You may spend or save at will.
zh: 钱你可以随便花，也可以攒着。

en: Spending money is as easy as pie.
I wish I had more money with me.
zh: 要是我身上多带点儿钱就好了。

en: With all his money, he is not happy.
zh: 哪怕他有那么多钱，他也并不开心。

en: You had better not waste your money.
I have a lot of money.
Please leave some money.
If you have any money, please lend me some.
zh: 要是你手头有钱，请借我点儿。

en: Can I borrow some money from you?
It goes without saying that health is above wealth.
zh: 毫无疑问，健康比财富更重要。

en: I don't have much money, but I can get along somehow.
zh: 我没多少钱，但总能凑合过。

en: I'll give you back the money tomorrow.
Lend money only to such as will repay it.
zh: 钱只借给那些会还的人。

en: Money is used for buying or selling goods, measuring value and storing wealth.
zh: 钱是用来买卖商品、衡量价值和储存财富的。

en: You should be careful of your money.
The money amounts to almost two thousands dollars.
zh: 这笔钱差不多有两千块。

en: You must make good use of money.
You cannot substitute money for health.
Money will do anything.
You should turn money to good use.
zh: 你应该把钱用在正道上。

en: I have hardly any money left.
There was scarcely any money left.
How much money do you have?
I have little money. However, I feel happy with you.
zh: 我没多少钱，但和你在一起我很开心。

en: Money answers all things.
I do not want any money.
How much money do you have with you?
I'm not worried about the price.
Money takes a long time to earn, but you can spend it in no time.
zh: 挣钱得老半天，花钱一眨眼。

en: How would you like them?
Do you have much money with you?
If you have any money with you, please lend me some.
zh: 如果你身上有钱，借我点。

en: Do you have any money with you?
She is exact in money matters.
zh: 她在钱的事情上算得很清。

en: Can you imagine the world without money?
zh: 你能想象一个没有钱的世界吗？

en: Some people write books for money, others for pleasure.
zh: 有些人写书是为了赚钱，有些人是为了兴趣。

en: If she continues to live with a man she doesn't love for his money, the day will come when she will be utterly frustrated and between the devil and the deep blue sea.
zh: 如果她为了钱继续和一个不爱的人生活，早晚有一天她会感到绝望并陷入进退两难的境地。

en: I'll try Jane for some money.
Stop arguing about money.
Money counts for little.
Money, as such, has no meaning.
Moving money and technology from one side of the globe to the other is not enough.
zh: 光是在全球范围内转移资金和技术是不够的。

en: I want money.
Since we have no money, it's no use thinking of a holiday.
zh: 既然没钱，也就别想去度假了。

en: If you need money, I'll lend you some.
Love is as important to me as money is to her.
zh: 对我来说爱情很重要，就像钱对她很重要一样。

en: Do you need much money?
Money has changed his life.
I am running short of money.
Lack of money brought my travel plans to an end.
zh: 没钱让我的旅行计划泡汤了。

en: I can't do it for want of money.
If I had enough money, I could buy this book.
zh: 要是有足够的钱，我就能买这本书了。

en: It is generally believed that money brings happiness.
zh: 大家普遍认为金钱能带来幸福。

en: I have run short of money.
Our money ran out.
I can't buy it for lack for money.
We could not continue our journey for lack of money.
zh: 因为没钱，我们没法继续旅行了。

en: It goes without saying that money is not everything.
zh: 不言而喻，钱不是万能的。

en: If you need some money, why don't you borrow some from your mother?
zh: 如果你需要钱，干嘛不找你妈借点？

en: You can withdraw some money out of the bank, if you need any.
zh: 如果你需要钱，可以去银行取点。

en: The idea that money can buy everything is wrong.
zh: 觉得钱能买到一切的想法是错误的。

en: Had I had enough money, I would have bought that computer.
zh: 要是我当初有足够的钱，我就买那台电脑了。

en: Now that I have enough money, I can get that camera.
zh: 现在钱够了，我可以买那台相机了。

en: I'm very happy to make your acquaintance.
I'm glad to know you.
If you are not in a hurry, please stay a little longer.
zh: 如果你不赶时间的话，再多坐会儿吧。

en: How about cup of tea or something, if you aren't in a hurry?
zh: 如果不急的话，喝杯茶什么的怎么样？

en: How was your holiday?
The holiday was up very quickly.
Good night and sweet dreams.
We have a parking lot for the customers.
zh: 我们这儿有专门给客人用的停车场。

en: You mustn't keep your guest waiting outside.
zh: 你可不能让客人在外面等着。

en: What about you? Will you have orange juice, too?
The visitor has gone away five minutes before you came back.
zh: 你回来五分钟前，那个客人刚走。

en: Have all the passengers got on board yet?
Our guests should be here within an hour.
zh: 我们的客人应该一小时内到。

en: Is there a doctor in the house?
Earning our customers confidence and respect is this firm's objective.
zh: 赢得客户的信任和尊重是我们公司的目标。

en: Please write down your home address.
We are trying to clarify your future procurement requirements.
zh: 我们正试着弄清你们未来的采购需求。

en: We aim to please.
zh: 顾客满意就是我们的宗旨。

en: Could I ask you to get a cup of tea for our guest?
zh: 能麻烦你给客人倒杯茶吗？

en: Sir, you have left your lighter on the table.
zh: 先生，您的打火机落在桌子上了。

en: We have to take great pains to make our guests feel comfortable.
zh: 我们费了不少心思让客人感到舒服。

en: Our guests have arrived.
I'm sorry, sir, but a jacket and tie are required.
zh: 抱歉先生，这里要求穿外套、系领带。

en: The guests were waited on by a highly trained team of young staff.
zh: 招待客人的是一队受过专业训练的年轻人。

en: The customers were made to wait outside in the rain for several hours.
zh: 顾客们被晾在外面淋着雨等了好几个小时。

en: We must keep the customers satisfied.
The guests listened to a number of speeches.
zh: 客人们听了好几场演讲。

en: We had no customers, so we shut the shop early.
zh: 没客人，所以我们早早就关门了。

en: A customer came and so tea was brewed.
zh: 来了位客人，于是就泡了壶茶。

en: A customer is having his shoes shined on a slapped-together stand.
zh: 有个客人正在一个简易摊位上擦鞋。

en: We sold the store for want of customers.
zh: 因为没生意，我们把店卖了。

en: Did I hurt your feelings?
I am sorry for you.
I'm sorry for you.
Sorry, but you must have the wrong number.
Did I hurt your feelings? I meant no harm.
zh: 我伤到你了吗？我不是故意的。

en: How would you like it?
Glad you like it.
Don't forget to take your umbrella when you leave.
Give me a telephone call when you get back.
zh: 你回来后给我打个电话。

en: Welcome home.
Will you do me a favor?
I wonder if you could do me a favor.
zh: 我在想你能不能帮我个忙。

en: Please be quiet for mercy's sake during the lesson.
zh: 上课的时候，求求你们安静点吧。

en: Be an angel and turn the radio down.
zh: 帮帮忙，把收音机音量调小点。

en: For the love of Heaven, don't get angry.
zh: 算我求你了，千万别生气。

en: Don't refer to this matter again, please.
For God's sake don't tell it to anyone.
zh: 算我求你，千万别告诉任何人。

en: Come on! Give me a chance.
I'd like to ask a favor of you.
Could you do me a favor? Will you lend me some money?
zh: 能帮我个忙吗？借点钱给我行吗？

en: I do beseech you, hear me through.
zh: 我求求你了，听我把话说完。

en: Thank you for sending the product information asked for.
zh: 谢谢你发来的产品资料。

en: Please hurry up!
Your face is familiar to me.
Come nearer so that I can see your face.
zh: 走近点儿，让我看清你的脸。

en: I'm afraid you have the wrong number.
zh: 我想你应该是打错电话了。

en: Here is your bill.
The poor educational policy is a detriment to Japan.
zh: 糟糕的教育政策对日本很不利。

en: Won't you sit down?
Please take your seat.
You're enjoying yourself.
Please pay the cashier.
It's nice to meet you.
I'm very happy to meet you.
How glad I am to see you!
I'm charmed to meet you.
It was a pleasure to meet you.
Would you please let me know when it would be convenient for us to meet?
zh: 麻烦告诉我你什么时候方便见面？

en: Please help yourself to the sweets.
The boy had been crying until he got some candy.
zh: 那个男孩一直哭，直到拿到了糖果。

en: The baby almost choked on a piece of candy.
zh: 那个宝宝差点被一颗糖给噎着。

en: You must see to it that the cakes do not burn.
zh: 你得看着点，别把蛋糕烤焦了。

en: Shall I carry your baggage?
zh: 需不需要我帮你拿行李？

en: Is this all you have, sir?
How many pieces of baggage do you have?
Why don't we go and see the cherry blossoms?
I take lessons in flower arrangement.
Shall I change the water for the flowers?
Do come and see us when you are free.
It's time to be going.
Can you wait until I make up my face?
The haunted house? I won't be able to sleep at night.
zh: 鬼屋？那我晚上该吓得睡不着觉了。

en: Would you bring me some salt?
Pass me the salt.
Could you please pass me the salt?
I've heard a lot about you.
I have heard quite a lot about you.
zh: 我听说过不少关于你的事。

en: Would you care for drinks?
Do you want something to drink?
I'd like to say yes, but...
Certainly. I'd be glad to.
Did you go to see a doctor?
The doctor told you to stay in bed until your fever goes down, didn't he?
zh: 医生让你退烧前要卧床休息，对吧？

en: My sides ache, doctor.
If you need to go off-line, that is fine.
zh: 如果你需要下线，没关系的。

en: It is a sad house where the hen crows louder than the cock.
zh: 家里要是母鸡比公鸡嗓门还大，这日子就没法过了。

en: It is the hen that makes the rooster crow.
zh: 其实是母鸡让公鸡打鸣的。

en: I have something to live for in music.
zh: 音乐是我活下去的动力。

en: Let's begin at the last line but one.
zh: 我们从倒数第二行开始吧。

en: I'll peel an orange for you.
I prefer apples to oranges.
zh: 比起橙子，我更喜欢苹果。

en: Oranges grow in warm countries.
zh: 橙子生长在温暖的国家。

en: Oranges are sweeter than lemons.
Oranges have a high vitamin content.
zh: 橙子的维生素含量很高。

en: It was so sour an orange that I could not eat it.
zh: 这橙子太酸了，我吃不下。

en: Oranges contain a lot of vitamin C.
zh: 橙子含有大量的维生素C。

en: The price of oranges has come down.
Oranges are rich in vitamin C.
A glass of orange juice refreshed me.
zh: 喝了一杯橙汁后我感觉精神多了。

en: I'd like orange juice.
Two glasses of orange juice, please.
Orange juice, and two eggs over easy.
zh: 一杯橙汁，还有两个双面嫩煎蛋。

en: I want an orange juice or something.
"Orange Cards" are available from the conductor.
zh: “橙卡”可以从乘务员那里买到。

en: You're barking up the wrong tree.
I don't see anything.
Am I not right?
Don't take it out on me.
I do not know the meaning of hatred.
We will go but you won't.
Mr. Brown, a friend from Oregon, will visit us tomorrow.

en: I'm glad to say that the boss has been very well lately.
zh: 我很欣慰老板最近身体挺不错的。

en: Shut up and listen, kid.
The group of noisy boys was getting out of hand.
zh: 那群吵吵闹闹的男孩子快要管不住了。

en: Don't look at her enviously.
zh: 别用那种羡慕的眼神看着她。

en: Uranium is used in the production of nuclear power.
The soft gentle sunlight beckoned me off to sleep.
zh: 柔和的阳光晒得我想睡觉。

en: Please wish me luck.
I hope it'll come out good.
I hope it pans out.
I will hope for the best.
Words fail me.
They talked for hours at cross purposes.
zh: 他们鸡同鸭讲地聊了好几个小时。

en: There are no students who can speak English well.
zh: 没一个学生英语说得好的。

en: If you want it done well, I'm your man.
zh: 要想把这活儿干好，找我就对了。

en: I hope everything is okay.
Those two used to get along so well together but even with them you can sense a chill coming on.
zh: 他俩以前关系那么好，可现在连他们之间都能感觉到有点冷淡了。

en: I can produce several pieces a day if I'm lucky.
zh: 运气好的话，我一天能做出好几件。

en: There is a good chance of success.
She studied very hard in order that she might succeed.
zh: 她为了能成功，学习特别刻苦。

en: I didn't expect to succeed, but somehow I managed to carry it off.
zh: 我本来没指望能成功，但不知怎么竟然搞定了。

en: You've sure got the teacher's number.
zh: 你可真是把老师的脾气摸透了。

en: All those who made the grade in entering that school could not have done so only by cramming.
zh: 考上那所学校的人，光靠死记硬背肯定是不行的。

en: It is not always easy to make a good joke.
zh: 想讲个好笑的笑话可没那么容易。

en: You put things well.
That's a good approach.
A good diplomat is a person who practises the technique of letting someone else let the cat out of the bag.
zh: 优秀的外交官就是那种能让别人说漏嘴的人。

en: That looks like the kind of guy who'd buy me lots of designer goods tee-hee-hee.
zh: 那人看起来像是会给我买一大堆名牌货的那种，嘿嘿嘿。

en: A man's vanity is his tenderest spot.
zh: 男人的虚荣心是他最碰不得的地方。

en: Conceited people take it for granted that they are superior to others.
zh: 自命不凡的人总觉得自个儿比别人强。

en: He's in the money.
A nod is a sign of agreement.
Some people dislike eels because they look like snakes.
zh: 有些人不喜欢鳗鱼，因为它们长得像蛇。

en: I must have gone past the station while I was taking a nap.
zh: 我打盹的时候肯定坐过站了。

en: I lie on my face.
Please lie on your stomach.
Mrs. Wood was a very good cook.
He ate Mr Wood's good country food, and drank a lot of milk.
zh: 他吃了伍德先生做的地道乡村菜，还喝了好多牛奶。

en: Mr Wood has his secretary type his letters.
zh: 伍德先生让秘书帮他打信。

en: Mr Wood loved Linda dearly.
zh: 伍德先生非常疼爱琳达。

en: Mr Wood had no sons.
Mr Wood was like a father to Tony.
zh: 伍德先生对托尼就像父亲一样。

en: Mr Wood came into the field.
